div.p: St. George Academy is a tuition-free, charter high school in Washington Fields, serving grades 8-12. SGA offers a college preparatory education to our students in a unique learning environment. Our faculty, staff, and administration know that an education is more than facts and standardized tests.
At St. George Academy, we believe that the true value of an education is its power to transform the individual and to provide them the knowledge to understand the world around them.

div.p:
Dr. Lewis has been involved in the historic profession for nearly two decades, researching and traveling widely throughout Europe and the United States. His main academic interests intersect traditional historic methodologies with media analysis, particularly in the study of totalitarian societies.
.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_3 fusion-builder-column-20 fusion-one-third fusion-animated 1_3
fusion-title title fusion-title-12 fusion-sep-none fusion-title-center fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-three

div.p:
Christy Hall has been in education for 18 years. She teaches both mathematics and literature, but her love is the cultural studies of mythology. In 2007 she was named Teacher of the Year at Tuacahn High School and in 2011 she received the Utah Charter School Teacher of the Year.
.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_3 fusion-builder-column-21 fusion-one-third fusion-column-last fusion-animated 1_3
fusion-title title fusion-title-13 fusion-sep-none fusion-title-center fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-three

div.p: Jodi Jensen has degrees in psychology and counselor education. She is a licensed school counselor and a QPR Suicide Prevention Certified Gatekeeper Instructor. She believes that schools, families, and communities play a vital and integral role in each student's life, and understands the importance of educating the whole student.

fusion-title title fusion-title-14 fusion-sep-none fusion-title-center fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-two

div.p: Here’s what our students and their families say about us:

q.p: This is an awesome place with a sense of community and inclusion that creates a safe haven. Especially for students that don't fit well into the greater culture of southern Utah or the stereotypes, cliques, and clubs that exist in our public schools.
I am a student at St George Academy. I've attended to this school twice now, and this year I'm a junior. This school gives a chance to many smart kids out there to achieve their goals.

My daughter attends SGA, and has found an environment of diversity, creativity, and openness that has helped her to overcome anxiety and to make friends all while interacting with teaching staff that have been greatly successful in helping her to achieve standards of education that otherwise had given her difficulties.

There needs to be more diversity in Education. Charter schools that emphasize individual focus on students to excel and succeed need to be emphasized. Children are being lost and left behind and schools like this are going above and beyond to change it

I have spoken with Mr. Jones as he gave me a tour of the school. I was so impressed, I can't recall having met such smart leadership in business or education in ages. He's one of the most organized, creative and caring individuals in our community and he's doing a great job with those kids.
